Reason: Feminine 'they' (ellas) requires 她们, not masculine 他们
'trabajador' as adjective means hardworking, not worker (noun)
'hombre trabajador' = hardworking man, not worker (noun)
'ánimo' is noun spirit/mood, not imperative cheer up
'sueño' in 'tener sueño' context means sleepiness, not dream
'el' (no accent) is article 'the', not pronoun 'he' (él with accent)
Spanish 'la' is article - doesn't translate directly to Chinese (这=this)
Spanish 'los' is article - doesn't translate directly to Chinese (这=this)
'hermana' too specific as 姐姐 (older sister only) - use 姐妹 (general sister)
'primo' too specific as 表哥 (older maternal male cousin) - use general term
'prima' too specific as 表姐 (older maternal female cousin) - use general term
'turquesa' as color, not gemstone - add 色 for color

Display beautifully in fashion, not boastful show off
